2009/4/28 Gaurav Pandey <gaurav_dell@...>:
> For one of the projects, the development team is using JUnit to prepare test
> cases, however as a process, I have been asked to find out if JUnit and HPQC
> are compatible.
>
> I would request any suggestions/pointers/Challenges/best practices which
> would assist me in understanding the compatibility.

What do you mean by "are compatible"?

I posted something onto this list a while ago about how my team
integrated JUnit and QC on an earlier project.

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/21332


> I also have some questions which I was not able to figure out?
>
> 1. Is JUnit a unit testing tool? or is it a testing management tool in which
> we store test cases and test execution results

It's a library with which you can easily write unit tests.

> 2. I have download Junit from the http://www.junit.org/, however I have not
> been able to "load" the tool. I am not sure on which file to execute? I am
> running on Windows XP SP2.

The best way to run JUnit tests is from a Java IDE.  All modern IDEs
(IntelliJ, Eclipse, NetBeans) have built-in support for JUnit.

--Nat
